OrgName: Ernst & Young LLP and U.S. affiliates
activities: The following is a general description of how Ernst & Young LLP and its affiliates (“the Firm”) use personal formation obtained from the EU ("Protected Information"): (1) The Firm uses Protected Information pertaining to current and former personnel of the Firm and other member firms of the global Ernst & Young organization (“EY”) in connection with the management and operation of EY firms, making services and benefits available to such personnel and maintaining contact with former personnel. (2) The Firm uses Protected Information obtained from, or relating to, prospective and current clients of EY firms and their personnel to provide and offer services to such clients and to fulfill its professional obligations pertaining to such services. (3) To a limited extent, the Firm may process Protected Information pertaining to members of the general public to respond to requests for information from such individuals (for example, requests from individuals via our website). If a member of the general public makes an inquiry, we will use his or her Protected Information to provide them with the information or communications they requested.
contactoff1: Privacy Team, Office of Ethics and Compli

recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) (human resources data); International Centre for Dispute Resolution, the international division of the American Arbitration Association (ICDR/AAA) (other data)
